sponsor.partnerMessage: Emcar Stone Studio is now serving NWA! They are a family owned and operated full service fabrication and installation company that specializes in quartz, granite, marble, and quartzite countertops. Contact them today for a complimentary quote!

posts.title: A Custom Mobile Tap Has Arrived To NWA
posts.content:
The next best thing just arrived: The Beerdrop. 

  • Sip anywhere: The Beerdrop is a custom-built mobile tap that is based on the design of a teardrop camper. The camper has room for 5 kegs inside and is fully refrigerated so drinks will always be chilly. The aim of The Beerdrop Co. is to provide a one-of-a-kind experience at any type of event —weddings, birthday parties, concerts, bike races, graduations. You name it, and they can do it.
  • Choice cups: Any drink you desire can be put in a keg and served from the Beerdrop — beer, seltzer, wine, kombucha, cold brew coffee, soda, cocktails & mocktails. Again, you name it. The Beerdrop Co. will have your drinks fully refrigerated, fully mobile, and fully ready for your next event that is sure to be a hit! 

Learn more HERE.

posts.title: J.B. Hunt Named Among Best Businesses For Diversity by Forbes
posts.content:
J.B. Hunt has been recognized as a Best Employer for Diversity by Forbes for the second year in a row. 

  • Employee survey: Forbes partnered with Statista to survey more than 60,000 U.S individuals who work with companies with at least 1,000 employees on a number of criteria to come to their conclusions.
  • Intentionality: J.B. Hunt launched its Office of Inclusion in 2021 to help foster a more inclusive culture. By working closely with the college of business at the University of Arkansas, the company has worked to bring inclusivity to the supply chain industry as well.

For more details, click HERE.

posts.title: Cureate Courses To Host A Pitch Showcase And Dinner
posts.content:
Cureate Courses is hosting a local Pitch Showcase and Food Market today at The Jones Center in Springdale. 

  • The pitch: The latest Cureate Courses cohort will have a Pitch Showcase this evening which will not only result in one business owner taking home $5,000 for their business, but it will celebrate eight local, women-owned food and beverage small businesses. 
  • The delivery: The evening will feature dinner and a show with food and dessert from the participants available for purchase. There will be live music and complimentary mocktails as well at the free event, which will go from 5-8p. The pitching will start at 6p. 

Learn more about the event HERE.

posts.title: NWA Schools Rank Top Of US News Best High School List
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas schools are yet again at the top of the 2022 U.S. News ranking of the Best High Schools in Arkansas. 

  • Top spots: The staff at U.S. News reviewed nearly 24,000 public high schools in the U.S. and 267 make their rankings. Haas Hall Academy in Fayetteville ranked #13 in national rankings, and four out of the top five schools in Arkansas are in NWA. 
  • Schools: Haas Hall Academy in Fayetteville took the top spot in Arkansas followed by NWA Classical Academy High School, which ranked #201 nationally, and Bentonville High School, which ranked #630 nationally. Rogers New Technology High School ranked fifth in Arkansas schools below a school in Sherwood. 

See the full Arkansas ranking HERE.

posts.title: BITE NWA Returns Bigger Than Ever
posts.content:
BITE Northwest Arkansas is returning with an expanded three-part event series throughout the region in conjunction with the Walmart NWA Championship presented by P&G. 

  • Food experience: The BITE NWA food festival has always celebrated the region’s best cuisine, restaurants, and chefs, giving attendees an elevated culinary experience in their own backyard. Traditionally, BITE NWA is held in one place during #NWAChampionship Week, but this go-around is promising an elevated experience. 
  • Three parts: This year, the festival will kick off in Downtown Rogers on Friday, July 29 at Frisco Plaza. The second event will be on September 1 at The Jones Center in Springdale, and the series will conclude with the BITE Experience at the LGPA tournament at Pinnacle Country Club September 23-25. Tickets go on sale May 16. 

For more information about BITE NWA, click HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Voting laws: Listen in on a discussion of the impact of the four new voting laws in Arkansas
  • Schooling: Tyson Foods will now fund free college education for its employees.
  • River time: Public access has been expanded at the Buffalo National River.
  • In the seats: The Razorback Men's Basketball game attendance was first in the nation for the second season straight.
  • New degree: The U of A has launched an online degree in supply chain management.
  • Get over here: Let us know about your organization's initiative or event, and we'll see about putting it in our newsletter. Check out our advertising deals HERE.
